H0.text: Compounds are what chemical formulas represent while elements are represented by chemical symbols.

H1.text: Extracts are chemical formulas that represent the proportions of atoms in a compound, whereas elements are represented by chemical symbols.

H2.text: Pollutants are represented by chemical formulas, whereas elements are represented by chemical symbols.

H3.text: Solutions are what chemical formulas represent, while elements are represented by chemical symbols.

A4.text: A chemical formula identifies each constituent element by its chemical symbol and indicates the proportionate number of atoms of each element.

A5.text: Chemical formulae may be used in chemical equations to describe chemical reactions and other chemical transformations, such as the dissolving of ionic compounds into solution.
